docstring.long_description:
You can set various settings for the triggering of the bursts as well.
The burst mode is way to have signals come in "bursts" that are triggered
externally or with a timer for instance.

Requires a CONNECTION_33510B node at the start of the app to connect with
the instrument. The VISA address will then be listed under 'connection'.

This node should also work with compatible Keysight 33XXX wavefunction
generators (although they are untested).
docstring.short_description: Turn the Burst mode of a supported function generator on or off.

parameters.name: connection
parameters.description: The VISA address (requires the CONNECTION_MDO3XXX node).

parameters.name: on_off
parameters.description: Turn the burst mode on or off.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: The channel to modify the burst mode for.

parameters.name: trigger_source
parameters.description: Set the trigger_source (e.g. externally or timed).

parameters.name: trigger_delay
parameters.description: Delay the burst by this number of seconds after a trigger.

parameters.name: trigger_slope
parameters.description: If triggering is external, trigger on a positive or negative slope.

parameters.name: burst_mode
parameters.description: Set the burst mode for the WFG.

parameters.name: burst_ncycles
parameters.description: How many cycles to have in one burst.

parameters.name: burst_phase
parameters.description: What phase to start the burst with, in degrees.

parameters.name: burst_polarity
parameters.description: The polarity of the burst in Gated mode, normal or inverted.

returns.description: String: summary of burst mode settings.
